body_text.text: Outbreaks"(Mesh)) OR "Case Reports" (Publication Type)) OR ("Epidemiologic Studies"(Mesh) OR "Epidemiologic Study Characteristics as Topic"(Mesh))) OR ("Epidemiology"(Mesh) OR "epidemiology" (Subheading) OR "Molecular Epidemiology"(Mesh) OR "Bias (Epidemiology)"(Mesh) OR "Confounding Factors We identified 2,402 articles that met the search criteria. After scanning the titles and/or abstracts, we excluded 2,045 for the following reasons:
body_text.section: AND English(lang))) AND Humans(Mesh) AND English(lang))) AND ((((("Disease

body_text.text: 1. Did not occur in the United States.
body_text.section: AND English(lang))) AND Humans(Mesh) AND English(lang))) AND ((((("Disease

body_text.text: 2. Not relevant to work-related infectious disease.
body_text.section: AND English(lang))) AND Humans(Mesh) AND English(lang))) AND ((((("Disease

body_text.text: We also identified 40 HHE reports in the database and reviewed these along with the remaining articles. A total of 67 articles and 7 HHE reports from 66 infectious disease case investigations among workers were determined to be relevant to our topic, because each publication satisfied the following criteria:
body_text.section: AND English(lang))) AND Humans(Mesh) AND English(lang))) AND ((((("Disease

body_text.text: 1. It described a work-related infectious disease case investigation.
body_text.section: AND English(lang))) AND Humans(Mesh) AND English(lang))) AND ((((("Disease

body_text.text: 2. It mentioned one specific pathogen or disease.
body_text.section: AND English(lang))) AND Humans(Mesh) AND English(lang))) AND ((((("Disease

body_text.text: 3. It mentioned at least one specific occupational group or workplace. 4 . It reported at least one symptomatic patient or seroconversion among workers.

TABREF0.text: The event occurred in the United States from 2006 to 2015.The pathogens/diseases, industries (types of activity at the places of work), occupations (kinds of work), numbers of ill workers, transmission routes, and sources of exposure identified in this literature review are listed in AppendixTable 1. Data from reported case investigations of infectious diseases occurring in workplaces,
